{"step_by_step_thinking": "Fenestri vestibuli, also known as the oval window, is a membrane-covered opening that leads from the middle ear to the vestibule of the inner ear. It is not a rounded bulge produced by the first turn of the cochlea, nor a prominence produced due to the lateral semicircular canal, nor is it grooved by the tympanic plexus. It is an oval opening located posterosuperior to the promontory.", "answer_choice": "B"}
